intro: Adinandra masambensis, commonly known as the Sunda white ironwood, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in lowland and hill dipterocarp forests, reaching heights of up to 30 meters. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, while its fruits are woody capsules containing several seeds. Due to its valuable timber and ecological importance, it is often found in conservation areas and is considered a keystone species in its native habitat.
